meanings.definition: A unit of length equal to one thousandth of an inch.
meanings.sent1: The hair was so thin, it measured only a milla in width.
meanings.sent2: The jeweler carefully measured the gemstone with a milla ruler.
meanings.sent3: I asked for a milla of cheese on my sandwich, and they took it literally!
meanings.sent4: Her patience was as thin as a milla, ready to snap at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The milla of space between the shelves was just enough for the book to fit.

meanings.definition: A unit of currency in Ethiopia, equal to one thousandth of a birr.
meanings.sent1: She saved every milla she earned to buy a new dress.
meanings.sent2: The market vendor charged a few milla for a bunch of bananas.
meanings.sent3: I found a milla hidden in my pocket, a pleasant surprise!
meanings.sent4: His kindness was worth more than a milla of gold.
meanings.sent5: The beggar was grateful for every milla dropped into his cup.

meanings.sent1: The milla at the end of the number indicated a large quantity.
meanings.sent2: In Latin, 'milla' is used to represent a thousand of something.
meanings.sent3: The milla at the end of the word made it sound grandiose.
meanings.sent4: Her smile lit up the room like a milla of stars in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The milla of flowers in the garden created a colorful display.
